ngiemboon: À Zẅìge Ssé leen ńké fó jʉʼó, ńdɔgɔ Yěsô ńgee kwòŋotsẅɛ, páʼ Sátà ge kwaʼte yé.
en: Then   Jesus was led up by the Spirit into the wilderness to be tempted by the devil.  # 4:1 Jos 15:61; Jdg 1:16; Jn 1:6–7; Jms 1:14

ngiemboon: À la néŋe wó lyɛ̌ʼ láʼ móm lekùɔ né pà letsẅɛ́ʼ móm lekùɔ té pfɛ́ɛ mmó, nzyè gyáŋa yé.
en: After he had fasted forty days and forty nights,   he was hungry.

ngiemboon: Sátà tó ńkwaʼte yé, ńgɔɔn ngie: «Páʼ ɔɔ Míŋ Ssé la, leen ńké ńtsẅi né metóon pɛ̂ ngie e sele ńcʉ́ʼʉ mmó léjÿó, ɔ̀ jÿó.»
en: Then the tempter approached him and said, “If you are the Son of God, tell these stones to become bread.”

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó yé ngie: «Mé la ŋweʼe tsɛ̀ɛ Ŋwàʼne Ssé ngie: “Nyìŋ te lɔg pɔ́ ndàʼ mmó léjÿó gie à jÿǒ tá ńgwɔ́ wó wɔ́. À lɔg mbɔɔ yɛ̌ shwóŋè wɔ́ɔ gie á kẅɛɛ ncwò Ssé.”»
en: He answered, “It is written: Man must not live on bread alone but on every word that comes from the mouth of God.”   ,# 4:4 Dt 8:3

ngiemboon: Sátà leen ńdɔgɔ Yěsô ńgʉa lé Yelúzálèm, á tÿǒsoŋ ndʉalʉ̌a, ńtÿɔ́gɔ yé na ntsɔ̀ʼ gie ee na ndá Ssé,
en: Then the devil took him to the holy city, had him stand on the pinnacle of the temple,

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: «Páʼ ɔɔ Míŋ Ssé la, fó jʉʼɔɔn, ńkyɛ́, ńtyé ssé, mélàʼmie mé la ŋweʼe tsɛ̀ɛ Ŋwàʼne Ssé ngie: “Ssé ge tsẅi mecÿɔ́ʼ pé tó ḿbyɛ́bte gú, pɔ́ ge lɔg mbwó mɔ́b kaa gú tà ɔ́ le túu kwò jú na tóon wɔ́.”»
en: and said to him, “If you are the Son of God, throw yourself down. For it is written:

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó yé ngie: «Mé la gíŋe ńŋweʼe tsɛ̀ɛ Ŋwàʼne Ssé ngie: “Pɔ́ɔn lé láʼ ńkwaʼte Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé jù.”»
en: Jesus told him, “It is also written: Do not test the Lord your God.”   ,# 4:7 Dt 6:16

ngiemboon: Sátà gíŋe ńdɔgɔ yé ńgʉa ndùm tsɔ̌ lekwɛ́ sie é gʉa tàa tÿǒ, ńtyé wó, ńnyɛɛ yé mengwòŋo mengwòŋ mie ée tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó, mbɔɔ mmó gie pɔ́ lɔgɔ fáŋa,
en: Again, the devil took him to a very high mountain and showed him all the kingdoms of the world and their splendor.

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: «Ɔ̀ lɔɔn ńŋwɔ́ʼ nnɛ́ mvfò mèŋ, ńguʼte wɔ́ɔn, m bú ńná né gù.»
en: And he said to him, “I will give you all these things if you will fall down and worship me.”

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn né yé ngie: «Sátà, fó lejʉ́ŋ mèŋ ńtsíŋte nnɛ́, mélàʼmie mé la ŋweʼe tsɛ̀ɛ Ŋwàʼne Ssé ngie: “Nyìŋ guʼte pɔ́ ndàʼ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé gíle yé, ḿbiŋ ńjúʼ pɔ́ ndàʼ ncwò wé.”»
en: Then Jesus told him, “Go away,    Satan! For it is written: Worship the Lord your God, and serve only him.”   # 4:10 Dt 6:13,# 4:10 Dt 6:13; 1Ch 21:1

ngiemboon: Sátà leen ńké ńnyé Yěsô, mecÿɔ́ʼ Ssé tó, ńne ńkẅéte yé.
en: Then the devil left him, and angels came and began to serve him.

ngiemboon: Mé la néŋe Jÿâŋ ndátsǎŋ, Yěsô gÿo ńjúʼ, ńgʉa lé Ngalílîa.
en: When he heard that John had been arrested,   he withdrew into Galilee.  # 4:12 Lk 4:14; Jn 1:43; 2:11

ngiemboon: À la kúu Nǎzalɛd, ńcʉa cʉa ńgʉa ńnéŋe Kapɛ́ɛnàwum, á tÿǒsoŋ gie áa ngʉ̀ŋe letʉŋ Ngalílîa, á láʼ gie Zambuloŋ pɔ́ Nɛbtali tÿɔ́ʼte ńnéŋe soŋ.
en: He left Nazareth and went to live in Capernaum   by the sea, in the region of Zebulun and Naphtali.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ púʼu, tá nò gie Esáyà ntsẅìnkʉ̀ Ssé la gɔɔn lɔg ḿbumte. À la gɔɔn ngie:
en: This was to fulfill what was spoken through the prophet Isaiah:

ngiemboon: «Pi pà Zambuloŋ, mbɔɔ pi pà Nɛbtali,
en: Land of Zebulun and land of Naphtali,

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a pie é ka néŋe tsɛ̀ɛ nzěm, é kéen
en: The people who live in darkness

ngiemboon: Á fó púʼu, Yěsô zye léshwóŋo nò Ssé, ńne ńgɔɔn ngie: «Pi kúbe mà gẅi, mélàʼmie nò lefùɔ Ssé tsoté tà ne ḿbɔ́ɔnte!»
en: From then on Jesus began to preach, “Repent, because the kingdom of heaven    has come near.”

ngiemboon: Yěsô gÿo ne ńgiŋe ngʉ̀ŋe letʉŋ Ngalílîa, ńgyá Símò gẅie mé gíŋe ńtóŋo yé ngie Piɛ, mbɔɔ Ndeléyà gẅie aa fɛ̌ Símò ŋwɛ́. Pɔ́ ne maʼa lekÿo ntse, á nue pɔ́ laa pamaʼ messó.
en: As   he was walking along the Sea of Galilee,  # 4:18 Mt 15:29; Mk 7:31; Lk 5:1; Jn 6:1 he saw two brothers, Simon (who is called Peter), and his brother Andrew. They were casting a net into the sea #— #for they were fishermen.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: «Pi tó, ńcʉ́me nzèm mèŋ, n dɔgɔ gẅí ńgÿo pafaʼ pʉ̀a mesoŋ.»
en: “Follow me,” he told them, “and I will make you fish for    people.”

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gwóon ńnyé mekÿo mɔ́b, ńcʉ́me nzèm yé.
en: Immediately they left their nets and followed him.

ngiemboon: Mé náʼa ńzye ńgiŋ, Yěsô gyá Jÿâg pɔ́ Jÿâŋ, é gwɔ́ gubé Zebende, pâ tá wɔb pú ńgwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ kanúʼ ńne ńnyɛte mekÿo mɔ́b, á tóŋo wɔ́b.
en: Going on from there, he saw two other brothers, James the son of Zebedee, and his brother John. They were in a boat with Zebedee their father, preparing their nets, and he called them.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ leen ńnyé kanúʼ mbɔɔ tá wɔb ńcʉ́me nzèm yé.
en: Immediately they left the boat and their father and followed him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gÿo ne ńgwá ńgiŋe jʉʼ ntsèm tsɛ̀ɛ Ngalílîa, ńzíʼi pʉ̀a nò Ssé tsɛ̀ɛ mendá cúʼte pà Yúndà, ésáʼa nkʉ̀ mbòŋo gẅie é shwóŋo pʉ̀a páʼ lefùɔ Ssé ée púʼu, ńne ńgÿo nyìŋ gẅie à gẅiin pɔ́ yɛ̌ ntí guɔ wɔ́ɔ ka yɛ̌ ntí lɔ̌ʼ wɔ́ɔ, á zeŋe.
en: Now Jesus began to go all over Galilee,   teaching in their synagogues, preaching the good news of the kingdom, and healing every  # 4:23 Or every kind of disease and sickness  # 4:23 Or physical ailment among the people.  # 4:23 Mt 13:54; 24:14; Ac 10:38

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ púʼu, mé lɔg lezíŋ sé, ésa ngwòŋ Sili ntsèm. Mé ne ńdɔgɔ pʉ̀a metsèm pie meguɔ ntí ntí laa na pɔ́b, é pʉ̀a pie messé tepòŋ la ne ḿbue wɔ́b, mbɔɔ pagwe gwáʼ, lâ megàŋa kwʉ́ʼte ńtóo, Yěsô gÿo pɔ́ zeŋe.
en: Then the news about him spread throughout Syria.   So they brought to him all those who were afflicted, those suffering from various diseases and intense pains, the demon-possessed, the epileptics, and the paralytics.  # 4:24 Mt 8:16; 9:32; Mk 5:15; Jn 10:21 And he healed them.

ngiemboon: Aláʼ menùɔ menùɔ fó Ngalílîa, éfó Ndekapɔɔ, éfó Yelúzálèm, éfó Jẅindê tà mbɔɔ na yetsɔ̌ nzǐŋ ntse Juundʉŋ, ńcʉ́me nzèm yé.
en: Large crowds followed him from Galilee, the Decapolis, Jerusalem, Judea, and beyond the Jordan.
